title: Crispy Smashed Potatoes with Chili Crisp Tahini
instructions: Place potatoes in a large pot of cold, salted water. Bring to a boil, then simmer until fork tender (25-30 minutes).

While potatoes cook, make the dressing: combine mayo, yogurt, tahini, chili crisp, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, lime zest and juice in a bowl. Mix well, loosen with a splash of water if needed. Set aside in the fridge.
Once potatoes are fork tender, drain and let them steam dry completely (this is important!).
Place potatoes on a lined baking tray, leaving space between them. Using the bottom of a glass, firmly smash each potato flat in one motion.
Season with salt and pepper, drizzle generously with olive oil.
Roast for 30-45 minutes, flipping halfway, until completely crisp and golden. Add more oil if needed.
Let potatoes cool slightly. Add spring onion, coriander, and sesame seeds to the dressing.
In a large bowl, add half the dressing. Add the crispy potatoes and gently mix to coat. Add more dressing as needed.
Serve topped with extra spring onions, sesame seeds, and a drizzle of chili crisp.
notes: Jersey Royals are in season April-July and have an incredible nutty, buttery flavor. The key to crispy potatoes is letting them steam dry completely before smashing and roasting.
